entry.title: Blinken urges Aliyev to lift Karabakh blockade

media:group.media:title: Blinken urges Aliyev to lift Karabakh blockade
media:group.media:description:
üìçAzerbaijan‚Äôs blockade of Nagorno-Karabakh has entered its 44th day. üìçYesterday evening, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken held a telephone conversation with Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev, urging Baku to lift the blockade. üìçKremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters today that Russia continues ‚Äúthorough and complex work‚Äù with regard to dialogue with Armenia and Azerbaijan.

entry.title: Is Aliyev getting closer to crossing the international community‚Äôs redlines?

media:group.media:title: Is Aliyev getting closer to crossing the international community‚Äôs redlines?
media:group.media:description:
In the latest edition of Frontlines, hosts Karnig Kerkonian and Garo Ghazarian spoke to Karabakh State Minister Ruben Vardanyan about the unfolding humanitarian crisis in Artsakh (Nagorno-Karabakh). Vardanyan also explained why Azerbaijan may be getting closer to crossing the international community‚Äôs redlines.

entry.title: EU agrees to send 2-year mission to Armenia, in bid to stave off Azerbaijani aggression

media:group.media:title: EU agrees to send 2-year mission to Armenia, in bid to stave off Azerbaijani aggression
media:group.media:description:
As Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade of Artsakh continues, Azerbaijan has once again completely cut off the gas supply to Artsakh. As temperatures in Stepanakert hit -5, the Karabakh Information Center described the cutting of the gas supply as a means to besiege the civilian population of Artsakh.

media:group.media:description:
In 2022, like in years passed, some CivilNet investigations were used as the basis for legal processes and even government decisions regarding anti-corruption. Here are some of the articles and other pieces which had a legal impact and helped combat corruption in the country.
